availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Cook (Harrison County, Kentucky, distiller)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, distiller. Pennsylvania native. Son of Stephen B. Cook and Lydia Beecher Cook. Married to Sarah Wolford Cook c.1860. Father of Mary Cook, Charles Wolford Cook, and James Albert Cook. Laborer in Clarke County, Virginia in 1850. Master distiller in York, York County, Pennsylvania in 1860. Enrolled for military duty in Sixth District of Kentucky on July 1, 1863 (U.S.A). Distiller in Cynthiana, Harrison County, Kentucky in 1870. Employed Henry Renecker and Mary Renecker in Harrison County, Kentucky in 1870.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Clarke County, District 12, p. 403. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Pennsylvania, York County, York, p. 1056. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 190. Find A Grave, "James Albert Cook (September 20, 1830-July 22, 1873)," Memorial #43076292, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43076292 (accessed May 16, 2019). Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Harrison County, KY, July 1, 1863, p. 89. William Henry Perrin eds., _Bourbon, Scott, Harrison, and Nicholas Counties, Kentucky, with an Outline Sketch of the Blue Grass Region (Chicago, IL: O.L. Baskin & Co., Historical Publishers, Lakeside Building, 1882), 649 (accessed via HaitiTrust) KYR-0001-009-0065.
